intro: Meopsis setifolia, commonly known as the silky meops, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Its flowers are pale blue to white, with five petals, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Meopsis setifolia is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides.
